attributes.action: To review the rules governing state pensions for British subjects living in Canada
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I have been refused a state pension. Reason given - I was divorced by British husband after 15 years of marriage - my sin apparantly was to eventually remarry a Canadian.
My claim for a pension against my British husband 's contributions is for the years in the UK when he went out work, I had his children and stayed at home and ran his off licence. The husband decided to emigrate to Canada in 1961 and I had no choice but to go as well because he threatened to take the children. The Pensions Dept has refused my claim for these years as I was divorced.

rejection.details: This is a personal matter, unsuitable for a petition.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
